com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin

Class AssemblerInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.AssemblerInput

  • public class AssemblerInput
extends Object
    Represents the input to an assembly algorithm. Geneious will instantiate an instance of this class and pass it to an assembler via Assembler.assemble(Options, AssemblerInput, jebl.util.ProgressListener, com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.Assembler.Callback).
    Since:
    API 4.14 (Geneious 5.1.0)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AssemblerInput.DataType
      The sequencing technology that a sequencing library was generated from.
      class  AssemblerInput.Library
      A library of reads to be assembled, represented as a single document in Geneious.
      static class  AssemblerInput.PairedDataType
      Represents the type of paired read or mate pair data.
      static class  AssemblerInput.Properties
      Some properties that briefly summarise what the input will look like.
      static class  AssemblerInput.Read
      Represents a single read or input contig.
      class  AssemblerInput.Reads
      Provides the ability to iterate over all reads to be assembled.
      static class  AssemblerInput.ReferenceSequence
      Represents a reference sequence in an assembly.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AssemblerInput

        public AssemblerInput(List<AnnotatedPluginDocument> annotatedPluginDocuments,
                      List<AssemblerInput.ReferenceSequence> referenceSequences,
                      boolean extractSequencesFromContigs)
        Constructs some assembly input from documents that need not be loaded into memory.
        Parameters:
        annotatedPluginDocuments - the documents containing the reference sequences and reads to assembly
        referenceSequences - the reference sequences. This may be empty but must not be null.
        extractSequencesFromContigs - true to extract sequences from any contigs and provide them as stand-alone sequences rather than as part of a contig

      • AssemblerInput

        public AssemblerInput(List<AnnotatedPluginDocument> annotatedPluginDocuments,
                      List<AssemblerInput.ReferenceSequence> referenceSequences,
                      boolean extractSequencesFromContigs,
                      double fractionOfDataToUse)
        Constructs some assembly input from documents that need not be loaded into memory.
        Parameters:
        annotatedPluginDocuments - the documents containing the reference sequences and reads to assembly
        referenceSequences - the reference sequences. This may be empty but must not be null.
        extractSequencesFromContigs - true to extract sequences from any contigs and provide them as stand-alone sequences rather than as part of a contig
        fractionOfDataToUse - the fraction of the input data to provide to the assembler. Must be between 0 and 1. If any reference sequences are specified, this must be 1.0
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)

      • AssemblerInput

        public AssemblerInput(List<NucleotideSequenceDocument> referenceSequences,
                      List<NucleotideSequenceDocument> sequences,
                      List<SequenceAlignmentDocument.ReferencedSequence> referencedDocuments)
        Constructs some assembly input from sequences that are all in memory. Generally this constructor should only be used for test cases.
        Parameters:
        referenceSequences - the reference sequences. This may be empty but must not be null.
        sequences - the sequences to assemble. This may (but does not need to) contain the reference sequences too.
        referencedDocuments - an optional parallel list (equal in length to sequences) contaiing the referenced documents for each sequence. This may be null.

      • AssemblerInput

        public AssemblerInput(List<NucleotideSequenceDocument> referenceSequences,
                      SequenceListDocument sequenceListDocument)
        Constructs some assembly input from sequences that are all in memory. Generally this constructor should only be used for test cases.
        Parameters:
        referenceSequences - the reference sequences. This may be empty but must not be null.
        sequenceListDocument - a sequence list containg the sequences to assemble. This must not include any reference sequences.

    • Method Detail

      • setAllowDuplicateReferenceSequenceNames

        public void setAllowDuplicateReferenceSequenceNames(boolean allowDuplicateReferenceSequenceNames)
        Sets whether getReferenceSequence(int, jebl.util.ProgressListener) throws a DocumentOperationException if there are duplicate reference sequence names
        Parameters:
        allowDuplicateReferenceSequenceNames - false if getReferenceSequence(int, jebl.util.ProgressListener) throws a DocumentOperationException if there are duplicate reference sequence names
        Since:
        API 4.710 (Geneious 7.1.0)

      • setSampleName

        public void setSampleName(String sampleName)
        Sets a name describing the sequencing reads used as input
        Parameters:
        sampleName - the sample name, or empty String for no sample name
        Since:
        API 4.900 (Geneious 9.0.0)

      • getSampleName

        public String getSampleName()
        Returns:
        a name describing the sequencing reads used as input or empty String for no name. Will not be null.
        Since:
        API 4.900 (Geneious 9.0.0)

      • getNumberOfNucleotideSequences

        public static long getNumberOfNucleotideSequences(List<AnnotatedPluginDocument> documents)
        Gets the total number of nucleotide sequences contained in the given documents which may be individual sequences, sequence lists, or alignments/contigs.
        Parameters:
        documents - the documents to get the number of sequences in
        Returns:
        the total number of nucleotide sequences contained in the given documents

      • getNumberOfNucleotideSequences

        public static long getNumberOfNucleotideSequences(AnnotatedPluginDocument document)
        Gets the total number of nucleotide sequences contained in the given document which may be an individual sequence, sequence list, or alignment/contig.
        Parameters:
        document - the document to get the number of sequences in
        Returns:
        the total number of nucleotide sequences contained in the given document

      • getNumberOfSequencesToUseFromDocument

        public static long getNumberOfSequencesToUseFromDocument(long numberOfSequences,
                                                         double fractionOfDataToUse)
        When assembling using only a fraction of the data from each document, this is used to return the exact number of sequences used from each document.
        Parameters:
        numberOfSequences - the total number of sequences in a single document.
        fractionOfDataToUse - the fraction of sequences to use from each document. Must be between 0 and 1. At least 1 sequence will be used from each document.
        Returns:
        the number of sequences to use between 1 and numberOfSequences
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)

      • getReads

        public AssemblerInput.Reads getReads()
        Returns an object that allows you to iterate once over the reads, loading them into memory as required.

        To consider reads as groups of libraries, use getLibraries() instead.
        Returns:
        returns an object that allows you to iterate once over the reads, loading them into memory as required.
        See Also:
        getLibraries()

      • getLibraries

        public List<AssemblerInput.Library> getLibraries()
        Returns libraries of reads to be assembled where a library is a single document in Geneious. Currently this method is only supported for de novo assemblies.

        To consider reads individually, use getReads() instead
        Returns:
        the libraries to be assembled.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - when used on reference assemblies.
        Since:
        API 4.1000 (Geneious 10.0.0)
        See Also:
        getReads()

      • getNumberOfReadSequences

        public long getNumberOfReadSequences()
        Returns:
        the total number of reads, where a paired read counts as 2 reads for the purposes of this method.

      • getNumberOfReferenceSequences

        public int getNumberOfReferenceSequences()
        Get the total number of reference sequences being assembled to.

        This will always be 0 if the algorithm returned Assembler.ReferenceSequenceSupport.NoReferenceSequence from Assembler.getReferenceSequenceSupport().

        It will always be 1 if the algorithm returned Assembler.ReferenceSequenceSupport.SingleReferenceSequence from Assembler.getReferenceSequenceSupport().

        It will always be greater than or equal to 1 if the algorithm returned Assembler.ReferenceSequenceSupport.MultipleReferenceSequences from Assembler.getReferenceSequenceSupport().

        Returns:
        the total number of reference sequences being assembled to.

      • getReferenceSequence

        public NucleotideSequenceDocument getReferenceSequence(int referenceSequenceIndex,
                                                       ProgressListener progressListener)
                                                throws DocumentOperationException
        Gets one of the reference sequences for this assembly. De novo assemblers must not call this method.
        Parameters:
        referenceSequenceIndex - the index of the reference sequence to get between 0 and getNumberOfReferenceSequences()-1 inclusive.
        progressListener - a progress listener to report progress to while the reference sequence is loaded from disk.
        Returns:
        the reference sequence. Will not be null
        Throws:
        DocumentOperationException - if the reference sequence cannot be loaded

      • getReferenceSequenceReference

        public SequenceAlignmentDocument.ReferencedSequence getReferenceSequenceReference(int referenceSequenceIndex)
                                                                           throws DocumentOperationException
        Gets a reference to the document that the reference sequence came from. The referenced document is what Geneious goes to if you click on the little "Go to referenced document" icon to the left of the sequence names in the alignment/contig viewer.
        Parameters:
        referenceSequenceIndex - the index of the reference sequence to get between 0 and getNumberOfReferenceSequences()-1 inclusive.
        Returns:
        a reference to the document that the reference sequence came from or null if there is no reference sequence
        Throws:
        DocumentOperationException - if the referenced document cannot be obtained because of a failure to load the reference sequence.

      • isSetReferencedDocumentsOnContig

        public boolean isSetReferencedDocumentsOnContig()
        Returns true if the assembly implementation should set referenced documents/sequences (see SequenceAlignmentDocument.getReferencedSequence(int)) for the reads on generated contigs. Note that a referened sequence is not the same thing as a reference sequence (see SequenceAlignmentDocument.getContigReferenceSequenceIndex())) A referenced document is what Geneious goes to if you click on the little "Go to referenced document" icon to the left of the sequence names in the alignment/contig viewer.

        No matter what this method returns, assembly implementations should still set the a referenced document for the reference sequence.

        For performance reasons this method will return false on big data sets (those with more than 10,000 sequences by default)

        Returns:
        true if the assembly implementation should set referenced documents (which are not the same thing as a reference sequence) on generated contigs.

      • isSaveUnusedReads

        public boolean isSaveUnusedReads()
        Returns whether or not unused reads should be saved by the assembly. Geneious will only set this to true if Assembler.providesUnusedReads() returned true and the user checked the relevant checkbox. An assembler doesn't need to respect this setting. It can always provide unused reads using Assembler.Callback.addUnusedReads(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.sequence.SequenceListDocument, jebl.util.ProgressListener) or Assembler.Callback.addUnusedRead(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.AssemblerInput.Read, jebl.util.ProgressListener) and the callback will just ignore it if it doesn't want unused reads.
        Returns:
        whether or not unused reads should be saved by the assembly.
        Since:
        API 4.40 (Geneious 5.4.0)
        See Also:
        Assembler.providesUnusedReads()

      • setSaveUnusedReads

        public void setSaveUnusedReads(boolean saveUnusedReads)
        Sets whether or not unused reads should be saved by the assembly.
        Parameters:
        saveUnusedReads - true if unused reads should be saved by the assembly.
        Since:
        API 4.40 (Geneious 5.4.0)

      • isSaveUsedReads

        public boolean isSaveUsedReads()
        Returns whether or not used reads should be saved by the assembly. Geneious will only set this to true if Assembler.providesUsedReads() returned true and the user checked the relevant checkbox. An assembler doesn't need to respect this setting. It can always provide used reads using Assembler.Callback.addUsedRead(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.AssemblerInput.Read, jebl.util.ProgressListener) and the callback will just ignore it if it doesn't want used reads.
        Returns:
        whether or not used reads should be saved by the assembly.
        Since:
        API 4.50 (Geneious 5.5.0)
        See Also:
        Assembler.providesUsedReads()

      • setSaveUsedReads

        public void setSaveUsedReads(boolean saveUsedReads)
        Sets whether or not used reads should be saved by the assembly.
        Parameters:
        saveUsedReads - true if used reads should be saved by the assembly.
        Since:
        API 4.50 (Geneious 5.5.0)

      • isSaveUsedReadsIncludeMates

        public boolean isSaveUsedReadsIncludeMates()
        Returns whether or not the mates of used reads (even if that mate doesn't map) should be saved by the assembly. Geneious will only set this to true if Assembler.providesUsedReadsIncludeMates() returned true and the user checked the relevant checkbox. An assembler doesn't need to respect this setting. It can always provide used reads using Assembler.Callback.addUsedRead(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.AssemblerInput.Read, jebl.util.ProgressListener) and the callback will just ignore it if it doesn't want used reads.
        Returns:
        whether or not used reads should be saved by the assembly.
        Since:
        API 4.50 (Geneious 5.5.0)
        See Also:
        Assembler.providesUsedReads()

      • setGenerateContigs

        public void setGenerateContigs(boolean saveContigs)
        Sets whether or not contigs should be saved by the assembly.
        Parameters:
        saveContigs - true if contigs should be saved by the assembly.
        Since:
        API 4.50 (Geneious 5.5.0)

      • isGenerateContigs

        public boolean isGenerateContigs()
        Returns whether or not contigs should be produced by the assembly. Geneious will only set this to true if Assembler.getContigOutputSupport() did not return ConsensusOnly and the user checked the relevant checkbox (or they choose to save a generated consensus) An assembler doesn't need to respect this setting. It can always provide contigs using Assembler.Callback.addContigDocument(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.sequence.SequenceAlignmentDocument, com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.sequence.NucleotideSequenceDocument, boolean, jebl.util.ProgressListener) and the callback will just ignore it if it doesn't want contigs.
        Returns:
        whether or not contigs should be saved by the assembly.
        Since:
        API 4.50 (Geneious 5.5.0)
        See Also:
        )

      • setSaveUsedReadsIncludeMates

        public void setSaveUsedReadsIncludeMates(boolean saveUsedReadsIncludeMates)
        Sets whether or not the mates of used reads (even if that mate doesn't map) should be saved by the assembly.
        Parameters:
        saveUsedReadsIncludeMates - true if used reads and their mates should be saved by the assembly.
        Since:
        API 4.50 (Geneious 5.5.0)

      • setMaximumNumberOfContigsToGenerate

        public void setMaximumNumberOfContigsToGenerate(int maximumContigs)
        For performance reasons, the user may limit the algorithm to generating this many contigs. The implementation is recommended to only return the biggest contigs in this case.
        Parameters:
        maximumContigs - the maximum number of contigs the algorithm should return.

      • getMaximumNumberOfContigsToGenerate

        public int getMaximumNumberOfContigsToGenerate()
        For performance reasons, the user may limit the algorithm to generating this many contigs. The implementation is recommended to only return the biggest contigs in this case.
        Returns:
        the maximum number of contigs the algorithm should return.
